Hey, I havenâ€™t been on that high a dose of antidepressant (Iâ€™m on citalopram) but I completely relate to the killer headaches and feeling spaced out! I have had CBT for 6 weeks and I found that helped so much so Iâ€™m thinking of continuing it. But I donâ€™t think it will help me get past some of the annoying side effects of being on a higher dose. I highly recommend therapy! It was amazing to be able to talk to someone who wasnâ€™t there to judge you. 

Iâ€™m planning on going to a GP to ask about it all but they never really have enough time to talk through all these side effects. Iâ€™m wondering if I should go to a psychologist or something like that instead.

Iâ€™d been on 10mg for about 4 or 5 years and due to different circumstances in my life decided to go up another 10mg but Iâ€™m not sure itâ€™s doing what I really want it to now. I feel more capable of doing things without overthinking them, but itâ€™s numbed me out so much. I want to be able to do things, but not with hardly any emotions at all!

Ideally I would love to be completely off them altogether but my boyfriend believes Iâ€™m doing so much better on them and happier in general! But I honestly feel less happy in myself and hate feeling numb- especially towards him a lot of the time. I know I love him dearly, I just feel like not myself at the moment and it makes it harder to love him more fully. 

Weâ€™re discussing it atm, but I think heâ€™s scared I go down to 10mg again. But I think I would like to.
